intro: Conioselinum benthamii var. kamtschaticum, commonly known as the Kamtschaticum caraway, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Europe and western Siberia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
